page.title: 18 STUDS IN EXNING
page.content: The studs in this area are Brickfield, Hamilton, Northmore, Plantation and Red House.The studs are either public, private or a combination of both. A public stud is one which accepts mares from outside owners for covering by their stallions. A private stud is one which has its own mares which go to other studs for covering and which return to the home stud to foal. Most foals are sold as yearlings at Newmarket Sales. Three of the local studs own one or two stallions each. One does not have enough land to accommodate a stallion. The breeding season is from February 15 to July 15. The stallions will cover about 45 mares in a season. Foals are usually born between January and May. The gestation period for horses is about 11 months. In the 1985 season 47 colts and 58 fillies were born on the five studs.
